trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SEQ_00<tab>Wuk Evu wishes to spread word that the festival will soon be held.

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SEQ_01<tab>With Bakool Ja Ja's clumsy attempt to steal the float thwarted, the festivities can proceed as planned. Wuk Evu suggests that you let the villagers know that Ihih'hana will be held after all. True to form, he also strongly urges you to remember the traditional greeting when approaching the Hanuhanu. With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase containing the word “Ohokaliy” to greet the Ok'hanu villagers.

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SEQ_02<tab>The mere knowledge that Ihih'hana will take place seemingly infuses the dejected villagers with eager anticipation. You can now return to Wuk Evu and commence the long-awaited festival.

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SEQ_03<tab>Chosen by Linuhanu as the festival's guest of honor, Wuk Lamat boards the float and is carried in a growing procession towards the sacred site of Kozanuakiy. Once there, the true magic of Ihih'hana manifests, the concentrated aether of the festival-goers harnessed and dispersed throughout the land in a spectacular display. You and your companions rush to check the fields, where Wuk Lamat looks over the now-revitalized reeds with an expression of awe.

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SEQ_04<tab>Owing to the festivities, the better part of the fields have been restored. The remainder is soon tended to by Koana, who arrives with an alchemical concoction prepared with the aid of his “Archon allies”─an explanation which gives you and your comrades pause. Overjoyed with Wuk Lamat and Koana's successful efforts, Zanuhali awards them both with a keystone. The feat is complete, and your party now looks to return to Tuliyollal in preparation for the next challenge.

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SEQ_05<tab>Still giddy from the festival and her success with the reeds, Wuk Lamat thinks back on the wonderful people she's met on her journey. Excited for the encounters still to come, she ushers you along back to Tuliyollal and Xbalyav Ty'e.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SEQ_06<tab>Wuk Lamat is inordinately pleased with her progress thus far. With luck, the next stage of the contest will continue just as smoothly...
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_TODO_00<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, enter “Ohokaliy” to greet the Ok'hanu villagers.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Wuk Evu.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat again.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_001<tab>I'm glad we kept the float out of Bakool Ja Ja's clutches, but gods... He brushed me aside like I was a bothersome gnat.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ERENVILLE_000_005<tab>A tense encounter. I'm thankful Alphinaud thought to share those linkpearls.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_KRILE_000_010<tab>I'm thankful we made it back before anyone was seriously injured.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALPHINAUD_000_015<tab>Given the nature of the rite of succession, I expect such altercations are inevitable.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALISAIE_000_020<tab>He waited for us to leave so he could steal the float. A coward <var 1A 02 /var>and<var 1A 01 /var> a thief!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_LINUHANU_000_025<tab>I was so afraid Wuk Lamat would come to harm... Ok'hanu has seen enough death.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKEVU_000_030<tab>With that exciting interlude over, you'll be pleased to know that my repairs are finished as well.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKEVU_000_031<tab>Before we commence the festival, however, it would be a courtesy to inform the villagers that Ihih'hana will be held after all.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKEVU_000_032<tab>Go forth, but do not forget your greetings! At this stage, I should hope the reminder is unnecessary.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_033<tab>Ohokaliy! See? I remember!

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SYSTEM_000_034<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase containing the word “Ohokaliy” to greet the Ok'hanu villagers.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKEVU_000_040<tab>Don't tell me you've forgotten the greeting? Fine, watch closely...
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKEVU_000_045<tab>Ohokaliy!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SAYTODO_000_046<tab>Ohokaliy
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_050<tab><sigh> There's nothing to look forward to anymore...

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SYSTEM_000_051<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase containing the word “Ohokaliy” to greet the Ok'hanu villagers.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_052<tab>Ohokaliy!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_053<tab>The festival is about to begin? What do you expect me to say...

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_054<tab>...besides “Of course I'll be there!” Cleaning up the storm's aftermath may have been hard on us all, but the Lifting of Wings is tradition! And a joyous one at that!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUNOTFEELING04866_000_055<tab>I won't sit here brooding my days away! Give me a moment to get ready!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUMELANCHOLY04870_000_056<tab>Ugh... Without Ihih'hana, life feels so empty...

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SYSTEM_000_057<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase containing the word “Ohokaliy” to greet the Ok'hanu villagers.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUMELANCHOLY04870_000_058<tab>Ohokaliy!

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUMELANCHOLY04870_000_059<tab>Thank you for letting me know. I would very much like to attend the festival, but the repairs should be finished as soon as possible. What to do, what to do...
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUSAD04870_000_060<tab><sniff> So much has been taken from us... Why even try?

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_SYSTEM_000_061<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase containing the word “Ohokaliy” to greet the Ok'hanu villagers.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUSAD04870_000_062<tab>Ohokaliy!

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUSAD04870_000_063<tab>What? The float is fixed!? Our fallen friends would be glad to know that Ihih'hana will soon be underway. They would have wanted us to honor them with celebration, not let their loss deter us from it.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_HANUHANUSAD04870_000_064<tab>I must go and enjoy the festival for those who no longer can!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKEVU_000_070<tab>The Hanu were pleased to hear their festival was going ahead, I imagine?
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKEVU_000_071<tab>That is well. Once your friends return, the Lifting of Wings can begin at last.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_KRILE_000_080<tab>Even deprived of their usual sustenance, the Hanu seemed invigorated the moment the festival began. Ihih'hana truly is magical!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ERENVILLE_000_085<tab>I wasn't sure what to expect...but the festival was admittedly impressive.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALPHINAUD_000_090<tab>With their fields rejuvenated, the Hanuhanu, too, might finally replenish their flagging reserves of aether.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALISAIE_000_095<tab>I'd like to take a turn riding the float. ...What? It looked like fun! Don't pretend the thought didn't cross your mind.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKEVU_000_100<tab>I told you, didn't I? Spectacular.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_LINUHANU_000_105<tab>I was too quick to dismiss the idea that the float had arcane properties. I think I wanted to believe that no one knew more about Ihih'hana than me.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_LINUHANU_000_110<tab>As it turns out, there are many things I have yet to learn...
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_115<tab>Should I have left the float behind like that? I was so excited to see the reeds...

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_LINUHANU_000_116<tab>Nothing to worry yourself over. My brethren have been swept up by festival fever─last I saw, they were taking turns at the carrying poles on the way back to the village.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_LINUHANU_000_117<tab>Please, feel free to look over the fields and enjoy the sight of what you've accomplished.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_KRILE_000_200<tab>While Koana seems a decent sort, he strikes me as a man who likes to keep others at a distance.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ERENVILLE_000_201<tab>Two-headed troubles aside, Wuk Lamat completed the feat and earned a keystone. That's all that matters.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ERENVILLE_100_201<tab>That makes two out of seven keystones... So far, so good.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALPHINAUD_000_202<tab>I'm curious as to who these Archons the Second Promise mentioned could possibly be...
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALISAIE_000_203<tab>Where has Bakool Ja Ja gone, I wonder? And what did his follower mean by their “other” prospect...?
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_210<tab>My journey has just started and already I've met so many wonderful people.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_211<tab>Wuk Evu, for one. He's a bit eccentric, but everyone could stand to be as respectful of other cultures as he is.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_212<tab>And Linuhanu─it warmed my heart to see him honor his departed friend through Ihih'hana, and to help others do the same.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_213<tab>I can't help but feel excited thinking who else I might meet over the course of the contest. Come on, let's head back to Xbalyav Ty'e!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALPHINAUD_000_120<tab>The Hanu's festival must be as central to their traditions as the sundrop dance is to the Vanu.

TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALPHINAUD_000_121<tab>I have not forgotten our obligations to Wuk Lamat, but it's moments like these─when we can immerse ourselves in the cultures of others─that fill me with anticipation for the new experiences this adventure will bring us.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALISAIE_000_125<tab>I pray we don't cross paths with Bakool Ja Ja at the next feat...
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ALISAIE_000_126<tab>But even if we do, we've made a good start on these challenges. Hopefully we can keep it up.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_KRILE_000_130<tab>I noticed Zoraal Ja was not at the Hanu village...
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_KRILE_000_131<tab>Yet in a contest like this one, 'tis only a matter of time until the claimants are pitted against each other in direct competition.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ERENVILLE_000_135<tab>When Wuk Lamat declared her intention to save the festival, I feared where it would lead us. I'm glad to see my concerns were unfounded.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ERENVILLE_000_136<tab>...Traveling with so large and diverse a group is...unfamiliar to me. If she could see me now...
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_145<tab>And just like that, we found an elector and won our first keystone. I knew I was right to trust your instincts!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_146<tab>Come on! Let's keep things moving, and march onwards to Urqopacha!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ERENVILLE_000_147<tab>Chances are good we'll find an elector there as well. Before we do anything, however, we should see what your opportunistic Pelu friend has to say.
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_148<tab>Look at us!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_WUKLAMAT_000_149<tab>The contest has barely begun and we already have two keystones! Surely even my talented brothers aren't doing this well!
TEXT_KINGMA111_04870_ERENVILLE_000_150<tab>We can only hope.
